issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Tracking methods that hold FSNamesytemLock for too long

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
This is a followup of [HDFS-9145].

Actually the value of {{writeLockInterval}} should be captured within the lock. The current code has a race on {{writeLockHeldTimeStamp}}. Thanks to [~jingzhao] for reporting this.
fields.summary: Fix data race accessing writeLockHeldTimeStamp in FSNamesystem

This message was automatically generated.
The patch looks good to me. One nit is that the "isInfoEnabled" check may be unnecessary. Other than this +1.

The failing tests seem unrelated.

Thanks [~jingzhao] for your review. The v1 patch is to address the latest comment.
Thanks for updating the patch, [~liuml07]. Since the new change is trivial, I've committed this into trunk and branch-2 without running Jenkins again.
Thank you for reviewing this patch again and committing it.
